com.vmware.vcenter.lcm

Class ValidationStub

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.Stub
      • com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.ValidationStub
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Service, Validation, ValidationTypes

    public class ValidationStub
extends com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.Stub
implements Validation
    Remote stub implementation of the Validation API service.

    WARNING: Internal class, subject to change in future versions.

      • checkHostConfig_Task

        public java.lang.String checkHostConfig_Task(ValidationTypes.HostConfigRequest spec)
        Description copied from interface: Validation
        Validate the host configuration.
        1. 1. Return False if the provided appliance type, appliance size, and disk size combination is not valid.
        2. 2. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient memory allocated.
        3. 3. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient cpu allocated.
        4. 3. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient datastore space.

        Synchronous method overload. Result of the invocation is a task identifier which will be returned by this method.

        Specified by:
        checkHostConfig_Task in interface Validation
        Parameters:
        spec - The configuration needed to validate host configuration.
        Returns:
        identifier for the task created by this API invocation

      • checkUpgradeSourceAppliance_Task

        public java.lang.String checkUpgradeSourceAppliance_Task(ValidationTypes.UpgradeSourceApplianceRequest spec)
        Description copied from interface: Validation
        Validate the source appliance to be upgraded.
        1. 1. Return False if the provided source appliance credentials are incorrect
        2. 2. Return False if the provided source location credentials are incorrect.
        3. 3. Return False if upgrade runner precheck results in error.
        4. 4. Return False if export directory provided is invalid.

        Synchronous method overload. Result of the invocation is a task identifier which will be returned by this method.

        Specified by:
